Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.dijkstra

Class Dijkstra.ShortestPaths

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.dijkstra.Dijkstra.ShortestPaths
Enclosing class:
Dijkstra
public class Dijkstra.ShortestPaths extends Object
The ShortestPaths class provides methods for computing and retrieving the shortest paths from a source vertex to other vertices in a weighted directed graph. It implements Dijkstra's algorithm for solving the single-source shortest path problem. The graph must not contain negative edge weights.

  • Method Details

    • distTo

      public double distTo(int v)
      Returns the length of the shortest path from the source vertex to the specified vertex.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex for which the shortest path distance is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the shortest path distance to vertex v
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if v is not a valid vertex

    • hasPathTo

      public boolean hasPathTo(int v)
      Determines whether there is a path to the specified vertex in the graph.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex to check for a path
      Returns:
      true if there is a path to the specified vertex, false otherwise

    • pathTo

      public Iterable<DirectedEdge> pathTo(int v)
      Returns an iterable collection of directed edges that form the shortest path to the specified vertex v. If no path exists, the method returns null.
      Parameters:
      v - the destination vertex
      Returns:
      an iterable collection of DirectedEdge objects that represent the shortest path to vertex v, or null if no such path exists or if v is invalid
